clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Preoperative Intravenous Amantadine Sulfate on the Postoperative Early Cognitive Functions in a Elderly Patient With Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Preoperative Intravenous Amantadine Sulfate on the Postoperative Early Cognitive Functions in a Elderly Patient With Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the effect of preoperative intravenous administration of amantadine sulfate on the prevention of the development of early cognitive dysfunction in elderly patients undergoing laparoscopic radical prostatectomy

detailed_description.textblock: Investigators believe that the preoperative prophylactic amantadine sulphate will reduce the incidence of postoperative cognitive disfunction (POCD) in patients with laparoscopic radical prostatectomy due to the neuroprotective effect, alertness enhancing effect and neuron protective effects.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients randomly allocated to two treatment groups: Amantadine Sulphate group (Group I) and the placebo group (Group II). Participants will receive two doses of amantadine sulphate in the form of three-hour infusions. The first infusion will be administered 8 hours before the operation and the second infusion will be terminated just before the operation.
study_design_info.masking_description: Randomise double blind placebo- controlled study

primary_outcome.description: cognitive function scale, Patients will be administered 24 hours after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Verbal analog Pain Scores on rest and movement
secondary_outcome.description: A Research assistant, blinded to the group allocation, interviewed patients and collected data at 5 times intervals ( 2, 4, 6, 12, 24, 48 hours) in the 48 hours postoperatively. Patients were asked to rate their pain using verbal analog scale, where 0= no pain and 10= worst pain possible.

arm_group.description: 200 mg ıv Amantadine Sulphate in 500 cc solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA II-III Patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of disease related to central nervous system, history of psychiatric disease, history of previous open heart surgery, history of previous craniotomy, renal insufficiency, hepatic failure, history of arrhythmia pre-applied standardized Mini Mental Test (sMMT) less than 24 points
